Summary: The 3 West Club is described as a "great little hotel" that is clean, comfortable and staffed with friendly and helpful employees. It is located across the street from Rockefeller Center and near St. Patrick's Cathedral.

Hotel 414 is a small, intimate haven near Times Square with a charming leafy patio and rooms featuring photographic cityscapes and down comforters. Guests can enjoy breakfast together at a long table, creating a convivial atmosphere.

Many guests mention that the staff are friendly, helpful, and welcoming, with some recalling guest preferences from previous visits. Some guests also highlight the hotel's location in the heart of SoHo, close to shops and restaurants.

The hotel has a friendly, helpful staff that often addresses guests by name, and offers amenities such as newspapers, Kiehl's bath products, and evening turn-down service. It's located close to Central Park, shops, and restaurants, with comfortable beds and a cozy atmosphere.

70 Park Avenue is described as a small, cozy hotel, with Kimpton touches to make one feel at home, well-laid-out rooms, and helpful staff. Some guests mentioned the hotel's welcoming atmosphere and the friendly and accommodating nature of the staff.

The Ace Hotel has a lobby with a library, a central reading table, bookshelves, and tufted sofas. The hotel aims for a homelike feeling with inviting common spaces, and rooms feature guitars and vintage furniture.

The Affinia 50 is known for spacious rooms with kitchenettes and comfortable beds, and it's a friendly staff that offers a "welcome home" greeting. Some reviewers mention that the hotel has a "club room" for relaxing and free tea/coffee all day.

The Affinia Dumont is noted for its spacious apartment-style rooms with kitchenettes, comfortable beds, and a location in the quiet Murray Hill neighborhood. Many reviewers mentioned the friendly and helpful staff who made them feel welcome.

The Affinia Gardens is configured more like a residential building than a hotel, with a small, intimate reception area and spacious rooms with fully equipped kitchenettes, giving it a residential feel; many reviewers mention that the staff is friendly, helpful, and makes them feel at home. Some guests feel like they are borrowing an upscale apartment for the weekend, describing the accommodations as spacious and comfortable.

The Affinia Manhattan is a centrally located hotel, directly across from Penn Station and Madison Square Garden, and offers spacious rooms, some with kitchens and comfortable beds, making it feel like a home away from home. Guests appreciate the friendly and helpful staff, as well as the convenience of having a mini-kitchen with a full-size fridge.

The Affinia Shelburne is described as comfortable with spacious rooms, kitchenettes, and friendly staff, creating a "home away from home" atmosphere; some reviewers specifically mention feeling welcomed and at ease. It has a good location and is near many sites of Manhattan.

AKA United Nations offers spacious, semi-furnished apartments with full kitchens, separate lounge areas, and comfortable beds, and provides services every day. Some reviewers mention the well-equipped kitchens, comfortable living spaces, and the availability of breakfast and coffee.

The Algonquin Hotel is often described as charming, cozy, and having a "homey" or "clubby" atmosphere with vintage decor, a resident cat (Matilda), and is known for its comfortable beds. Some guests found the staff friendly and helpful, contributing to a welcoming experience.

The Americana Inn is a budget-friendly option in midtown Manhattan with small, clean rooms, shared bathrooms, and a friendly staff, creating a safe and secure environment. Some reviewers mentioned long stays and repeat visits, with one reviewer saying they "will kept this adress in my notebook".

Amsterdam Court Hotel is known for its great location near Times Square and Broadway theaters, but the rooms are small and may lack natural light or views. Some guests have reported friendly staff, while others describe them as rude or unhelpful.

The Astor on the Park is a basic, clean hotel with friendly, helpful staff, where rooms are cleaned daily; some reviewers mention that the hotel is frequented mainly by European guests, and the location is near Central Park. Some reviewers mention that the staff were happy to engage in conversation and offer advice.

The Bedford Hotel is located just two blocks from Grand Central Station and offers amenities such as kitchenettes, refrigerators, and coffee makers in the rooms. Many guests cite the friendly and helpful staff as a reason they would return.
The Beekman Tower is described as having large rooms with kitchens, giving it an apartment-like feel. Many guests mention the friendly staff, which makes it feel welcoming.

The Belleclaire Hotel is situated in a residential Upper West Side neighborhood, offering urban apartment-like rooms with some rooms having shared bathrooms. The staff is friendly and the location provides easy access to shops, restaurants, Central Park and the subway.

The Bentley Hotel is known for its friendly and helpful staff, with some reviewers noting that the staff went above and beyond to accommodate their needs, creating a special and caring atmosphere. Several guests mention the comfortable beds, cleanliness, and modern decor as contributing to a pleasant stay.

The Best Western Bowery Hanbee is located in Chinatown/Little Italy, with friendly staff, clean rooms, comfortable beds, and complimentary breakfast, making it a great value in Manhattan. Some reviewers mention they will be returning and feel at home, with heated floors and laminate-wood flooring.

The hotel is basic but clean, with friendly staff and a complimentary continental breakfast. Some reviewers mention that the rooms are small but comfortable, and the hotel is located within walking distance of Times Square.

The Best Western Hospitality House is an apartment-style hotel with spacious rooms including a full-size kitchen, living area, and separate bedrooms, where guests receive complimentary breakfast items. The hotel is centrally located, within walking distance to many attractions, and offers a comfortable, home-like atmosphere.

The Seaport Inn is a small, charming, and cozy hotel with a quiet atmosphere and friendly staff, making it suitable for short-term stays. Some reviewers mentioned that the hotel feels like a B&B and praised the hotel's charm.

The Blue Moon Hotel is a small, unique, and charming hotel that is known for its warm, friendly atmosphere and helpful staff, making guests feel welcomed. Many reviewers mention that the hotel feels like a home away from home due to personalized service, a friendly atmosphere, and opportunities to bond with other guests.
The Broadway Plaza Hotel has friendly, helpful staff, clean and spacious rooms and offers complimentary tea and coffee 24/7. The hotel is centrally located and close to the subway.

The Buckingham Hotel offers apartment-style suites with fully equipped kitchens, separate living rooms, and spacious bedrooms, creating a home-like atmosphere. Many reviewers highlight the friendly staff and the hotel's location near Central Park, Carnegie Hall, and subway lines.

The Candlewood Suites offers studio suites with a mini-kitchen including a full-sized fridge, free laundry room, and free in-room wireless, creating a comfortable and convenient experience. Some guests found the rooms cozy and well-equipped for a longer stay, with amenities like a full-size refrigerator and a small but well-equipped kitchen.

The Carlton Arms is described as an old, funky, and unique hotel with each room individually painted by local artists, offering a different experience with friendly staff and a resident cat. Some reviewers mention the hotel feels like a "home away from home" or a "neighborhood," with a laid-back atmosphere and a sense of community among guests.
The Carvi Hotel has a friendly general manager, cordial front desk reception, and clean rooms. Some found the staff made them feel at home.

The Casablanca Hotel is known for friendly and helpful staff that provides an exceptional level of service, creating a home-away-from-home atmosphere. It has amenities like a breakfast buffet, wine and cheese in the evenings, and a lounge with free coffee, tea, and snacks.

The Chambers Hotel is a small, high-class boutique hotel with elegant style and service, with staff particularly excellent to regular guests. The hotel has a relaxed but sophisticated atmosphere with a neighborhood setting that provides a world of food, shopping, and entertainment options.

Chelsea Lodge is a charming, clean, and cozy guesthouse with quirky, New England-style decorated rooms, offering a homely atmosphere and a sense of living like a local in a safe and quiet Chelsea neighborhood. Guests appreciate the friendly staff, convenient location near subway stations, and the availability of amenities like free Wi-Fi.

Chelsea Pines Inn is known for its friendly and helpful staff, with many reviewers mentioning how welcome they felt, with some indicating they have been returning for as long as 20 years. It has a warm and welcoming atmosphere, movie-themed decor, a pleasant breakfast area, and even a resident cat, making it feel like home.
The Chelsea Savoy is a conveniently located hotel, near the subway, with clean rooms. Some reviewers have stayed at the hotel multiple times.

The City Club Hotel is a small, intimate hotel with a friendly staff that some guests found made them feel like family. It features comfortable beds, and offers nice extras like turn-down service with cookies.

The Solita Soho is praised for its genuinely friendly and helpful staff, making guests feel welcomed and well-looked after, and some reviewers have been returning for years. It is located close to family residences with quiet floors, creating a comfortable and familiar atmosphere.

The Club Quarters Downtown is known for its clean, modern rooms and helpful staff, making it a comfortable and convenient option, with amenities like complimentary water and a guest closet with extra pillows and blankets. Some reviewers mentioned the hotel provided everything they needed, enjoyed the quiet atmosphere of the Financial District, and felt like part of the CQ family.

The Club Quarters Midtown is known for its small, but clean and modern rooms, and its excellent location near Times Square and other attractions. It caters to business travelers with amenities like free Wi-Fi and a comfortable workspace, but has limited services and some reports of impersonal staff.

Club Quarters Rockefeller Center offers a comfortable stay with amenities like free water, a fitness room, and a 7th-floor terrace, creating a relaxing environment. Some rooms include a kitchenette, and the hotel provides free internet access and computer terminals.

The Comfort Inn Chelsea's staff is helpful, friendly, and courteous, making guests feel like they are staying with family, and it is located near many attractions and public transportation. Some reviewers mention the availability of family suites, refrigerators, and safety deposit boxes.

The Comfort Inn Manhattan is praised for its central location, friendly and helpful staff, and clean, comfortable rooms. Some reviewers mention that the staff made them feel welcome and at home, suggesting a personal and hospitable atmosphere.

The Comfort Inn Manhattan Bridge offers clean, modern rooms with comfortable beds, free Wi-Fi, and complimentary breakfast, making it a good value for money. Some reviewers felt at home in the Chinatown location due to the neighborhood's lively atmosphere and proximity to various points of interest, despite its chaotic and sometimes unclean environment.

This hotel is praised for its friendly and helpful staff, with many reviewers noting the same staff members year after year, creating a familiar and welcoming atmosphere. The rooms have comfortable beds and modern furnishings, and amenities like free internet and breakfast are available.
The hotel offers free coffee and tea all day, a free continental breakfast, and rooms equipped with a coffee maker. Some reviewers highlight the friendly and helpful staff.

The hotel offers a free continental breakfast, with coffee and juice available all day, and has a friendly, helpful staff. Some reviewers mention that the hotel feels more like a hostel, but the rooms are kept clean.

The staff is very friendly, helpful, and accommodating, with some reviewers mentioning specific staff members by name and praising their exceptional service; rooms include complimentary water, tea/coffee, and a safe, and the hotel will hold luggage after checkout. Some reviewers mention feeling safe and secure, and that the staff treats each guest as family.

The Cooper Square Hotel aims to create a welcoming and intimate atmosphere, offering a "living room" style lobby with a fireplace, books, and complimentary drinks. Some reviewers mention that the staff is friendly and makes guests feel at home.

The Cosmopolitan Hotel is a clean and well-maintained budget hotel with a friendly staff and a convenient Tribeca location near subway lines, offering a pleasant stay for repeat visitors. Marcela at the front desk is noted as being very helpful and pleasant, with staff remembering guests' names.
The hotel has a friendly, accommodating staff and a convenient location near many attractions. It is described as clean, comfortable, and making you feel at "home."

The Courtyard Upper East Side is known for its friendly, outgoing, and dedicated staff, offering a family-run feel, and is located in a neighborhood that allows guests to explore non-touristy urban areas. The hotel offers amenities such as wired internet access, a fitness room, and a coin-operated washer-dryer.
The hotel is centrally located near many attractions, and some reviewers mention friendly and helpful staff. Some guests felt at home and were recognized by staff on return visits.

The Courtyard Midtown East is known for its friendly and helpful staff, with some reviewers describing the hotel as feeling like a home away from home and noting personalized touches. The hotel also offers a comfortable setting, with clean, spacious rooms and comfortable beds.

The Crosby Street Hotel is known for its exceptional service, attention to detail, and warm atmosphere, making guests feel like royalty. The hotel features individually designed, spacious rooms, a welcoming staff, and unique touches like a chef who prepares special requests.

Some guests described the Crowne Plaza Times Square as having a "comfy, homely feel" and as "a calm quiet haven from the city," while others mentioned comfortable beds and efficient, friendly staff. One reviewer noted a repeat stay due to ease of access to Broadway, access to a private lounge, and a desk space suited for getting work done.

The Da Vinci is a small, family-operated hotel with friendly staff, a cozy lobby featuring a gas fireplace, and a restaurant and bar with a happy hour. Some reviewers felt the hotel had a warm, European-ish atmosphere.

The Doubletree Guest Suites Times Square is noted for offering service that makes guests feel remembered and comfortable. Some reviewers mention feeling secure, and that staff members were consistently kind and helpful.

The Doubletree Chelsea is a newer, modern hotel with a friendly and helpful staff, offering warm cookies upon arrival. Some reviewers mention that the staff remembered their names and provided personalized service.

Many reviewers mention that this hotel is in a convenient location that is close to main attractions and the subway. Some reviewers describe the rooms as being spacious, very clean, comfortable, and with great beds.

The hotel has robes, comfortable beds, and offers newspapers, fruit, and weather forecasts, with options to empty the minibar for fridge use and remove the top mattress layer for a firmer bed. Some found the hotel was clean, modern, and quiet, and the staff were very helpful.

The Duane Street Hotel has a warm and cozy vibe with a friendly staff that is helpful to concierge needs, making it feel like home. It's a small hotel, but the rooms are spacious (especially for New York) and it's located in a safe area to walk at night.

The Dylan Hotel is described as a comfortable and quiet sanctuary in midtown Manhattan, with spacious rooms and a friendly staff. Some reviewers mention it feeling like a "home away from home," praising the comfortable beds and convenient location near Grand Central Terminal.

The Eastgate Tower is frequently described as spacious with apartment-style suites that include kitchens, multiple closets, and separate living areas, making it suitable for families or longer stays. Many reviewers mention the friendly and helpful staff, contributing to a comfortable and welcoming atmosphere.

The hotel has friendly and helpful staff, offers free items such as breakfast and newspapers, and provides amenities, such as free coffee and tea, 24/7. Some reviewers felt safe, and indicated that the staff were willing to help with tourist questions and directions.

This hotel is known for its friendly staff who provide attentive guest service, making it feel like a home away from home, with return guests being remembered. Some rooms offer excellent views, and the hotel provides amenities such as free drinks and breakfast.

The Empire Hotel garners mixed reviews with mentions of small rooms, additional resort fees, and thin walls, but many appreciate its central location near Central Park and the subway, and enjoy the modern, recently renovated, stylish decor. There are some mentions of friendly staff, and a lobby bar that has a cool vibe, but some guests experienced issues with service, room cleanliness, heating, and noisy air conditioning.

The Envoy Club offers spacious apartment-style rooms with full kitchens, providing a "home away from home" feel, especially suitable for longer stays and families. It is located within walking distance of attractions like the Empire State Building.
The rooms are large, well-furnished, and equipped with a fridge, microwave, plasma TVs, and a comfortable armchair. There is a seating area, and some rooms have a leather couch.

The Excelsior Hotel is in a residential Upper West Side neighborhood, near Central Park and the subway, which provides a quiet retreat and a glimpse into local life. Some guests describe it as a "home away from home" and a comfortable place to stay.

The Fairfield Inn provides a welcoming atmosphere with a helpful staff that remembers guests and offers assistance. Guests feel at home with clean rooms, comfortable beds, and amenities like free internet.

The Fitzpatrick Grand Central is described as an intimate hotel with a warm and welcoming staff, aiming to be an Irish oasis in Manhattan. Reviews mention the friendly atmosphere, helpful staff, and a cozy lobby with fireplaces and books, creating a homely feel.

The Fitzpatrick Manhattan is known for its friendly and helpful staff, with many reviewers mentioning the welcoming atmosphere and personalized service. Some reviewers describe the hotel as a "home away from home" due to the attentive service and cozy Irish pub-style bar.

The Flatotel offers spacious rooms, some with kitchens, which can provide a comfortable, apartment-like stay; however, some reviewers noted a lack of homey touches in the decor. The hotel's location is convenient for accessing many midtown attractions, and some reviewers appreciated the helpfulness of the staff.

The Sheraton Chelsea is praised for its friendly and helpful staff, comfortable beds, and clean rooms, with many reviewers noting the staff's attentiveness and personalized service. Some reviewers mentioned that they frequently stay at this hotel, indicating a sense of comfort and familiarity.

The Four Points Soho has a friendly staff known to be helpful and accommodating, with some guests feeling like they were staying with family. Some rooms have comfortable beds, Starbucks coffee, and free Wi-Fi, with a small bar near reception where guests can sit outside.

Many reviewers found the beds very comfortable and the rooms functional, with some mentioning nice amenities such as free Wi-Fi, bottled water, and iHome docks. Some reviewers highlight the friendly and helpful staff, making it a pleasant stay despite the hotel's location in a somewhat gritty area.

The Four Seasons in NYC aims to provide a feeling of coming back home and offers amenities for children. Some found the rooms to be comfortable, clean, and spacious, but others found them sterile and unwelcoming.

Gild Hall is known for its attentive staff, personalized service, and comfortable rooms with luxurious linens, aiming to create a warm and welcoming environment. Some reviewers mention a neighborhood-like feel due to the quieter Financial District location.

The Gramercy Park Hotel offers spacious rooms with comfortable beds and a quiet atmosphere, some featuring park views and unique decor. Guests appreciate the friendly and helpful staff, and the option to access the private Gramercy Park.
Some guests mentioned that the staff are helpful and make them feel at home. One reviewer enjoyed staying at the hotel because it "feels like a home".

The Greenwich Hotel is known for its European decor and an atmosphere that feels like a home, with rooms decorated as if someone had lived there for a decade. Guests appreciate the comfortable common rooms, courtyard, and the staff's friendly, casual attentiveness.

The Hampton Inn offers complimentary breakfast, 24/7 beverage service, and a business center, with friendly staff who are helpful and accommodating. Some guests mention feeling welcomed and comfortable during their stay, and some found the staff went out of their way to assist with their needs.

The Hampton Inn Madison Square Garden is praised for its friendly and helpful staff, creating a welcoming atmosphere, and guests are made to feel at home. It offers amenities like complimentary breakfast, free internet access, and 24/7 coffee and tea, with some reviews specifically mentioning the staff's attention to detail and willingness to accommodate requests.

The Hampton Inn Chelsea is frequently described as clean, comfortable, and offering consistently good service, with many reviewers being repeat customers over several years, it's conveniently located near subway lines and various NYC attractions. Guests appreciate the friendly and helpful staff, reliable amenities, and the inclusive breakfast buffet, making it a familiar and welcoming place to stay in Manhattan.

The Hampton Inn SoHo is praised for its exceptionally friendly staff, cleanliness, and comfortable accommodations, making it a welcoming place to return to after a long day; some reviewers even referred to it as their "NY home." Many guests highlight the extra touches, such as friendly greetings, towel art by the cleaning staff, and occasional free cookies, which contributed to a positive and comfortable experience.

The Hampton Inn Times Square South offers clean and comfortable rooms, though small, with comfortable beds and pillows. The staff is friendly and goes out of its way to help, with a free breakfast and options for delivered meals.

The Hampton Inn Seaport/Financial District is known for its friendly and helpful staff who provide excellent service. Some reviewers felt recognized and greeted each time they walked in or out, which made for a welcoming experience.

The Helmsley Middletowne is an older hotel with spacious rooms, some including suites with kitchenettes and multiple closets, and offers a complimentary continental breakfast. The hotel is centrally located, with friendly staff, but the decor is dated and may need updating.

The Hilton Club is a hotel-within-a-hotel with suites located on the 37th and 38th floors that provides small hotel personal service. The rooms are newly decorated and make good use of the space with built in furnishings.

The Hilton Garden Inn Chelsea is praised for its friendly and helpful staff, clean and comfortable rooms, and a location that provides both accessibility to attractions and a quieter environment. Some reviewers mention the hotel felt like a reliable and pleasant place to return to, with comfortable beds and a well-equipped business center.

Many guests describe the Hilton Garden Inn on 35th Street as clean, comfortable, and offering a homey feeling with free tea and coffee in the lobby, a pantry to buy snacks, a refrigerator and microwave in the room. Some reviewers noted the staff were friendly and made them feel welcome and valued.
The Hilton Garden Inn Times Square has a friendly staff and comfortable, clean rooms that are well-appointed. Guests appreciate the hotel's convenient location and comfortable beds.
The hotel offers free internet, a business center, and a fitness center for guest use. Rooms include a refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, and comfortable beds with adjustable firmness.

The Hilton New York is described by one reviewer as familiar and another mentions they always felt at home there. A reviewer also notes the rooms are spacious and well maintained and the service and cleanliness were second to none.

The Hilton Times Square is known for being clean, quiet, and comfortable, with friendly and attentive staff, and many reviewers would stay again. Some reviewers felt welcomed upon arrival and throughout their stay, with staff sometimes offering advice, directions, and remembering guest's names.

The Holiday Inn Express offers a relaxing, clean, and quiet atmosphere with free amenities such as breakfast and Wi-Fi, making it a comfortable and convenient stay. The staff is friendly, helpful, and creates a welcoming environment.

The hotel offers clean and comfortable rooms with amenities like free breakfast, internet access, and friendly staff. Some reviewers mention the availability of coffee pots in the room, a comfortable bed, and helpful service personnel.

The Holiday Inn Express near Madison Square Garden is known for its friendly and helpful staff, creating a welcoming atmosphere; it is located close to attractions and transportation, offering a convenient and safe stay. Some Priority Club members get breakfast delivered to their rooms.
The Holiday Inn is located in Chinatown, near the subway, with clean, albeit small, rooms. Some reviewers found the staff friendly and helpful.

This hotel aims to provide a home-like atmosphere with affordable prices, a convenient location near transportation, and accommodating service. Features include clean, spacious rooms, and helpful staff.

The Holiday Inn has a friendly staff who are very helpful, with many reviewers commenting on the cleanliness and comfort of the hotel. Some found the hotel cozy and the location convenient to attractions and transportation.

Hotel 17 is a clean and cozy budget hotel with a friendly staff, European-style decor, and a quiet location near Union Square, making it feel like a home away from home; it caters to European tourists and offers weekly rentals. Some reviewers mention the hotel's location in a "real" part of NYC and the friendly reception as reasons to return.

Hotel 31 is a clean and quiet budget hotel with a friendly, helpful staff, and a quirky, old-style charm. Many guests report feeling safe and comfortable, with the #6 subway line close by for easy access to other parts of Manhattan.

Hotel 373 is a small, clean, and modern hotel located on 5th Avenue near the Empire State Building, with friendly staff and comfortable beds, and a Starbucks connected to the reception. Some reviewers mention a cozy atmosphere, while others note the lack of amenities such as a lobby or closet space.

Hotel 41 is described as a cozy and intimate boutique hotel with friendly, helpful staff who go the extra mile and provide a welcoming atmosphere. Some reviewers mentioned they are repeat customers, and that the hotel is well-situated, clean, and safe.

Hotel 99 is located on the Upper West Side and offers rooms equipped with writing desks, bedside tables, drawers, and flat screen TVs. Some reviewers noted the friendly staff and the hotel's location in a relatively quiet area.

The Hotel Beacon is frequently described as feeling like a home away from home due to its apartment-style rooms with kitchenettes, quiet atmosphere, and location in a residential Upper West Side neighborhood. Guests appreciate the spacious rooms, comfortable beds, and proximity to local shops and restaurants, creating a sense of community.

The Hotel Chandler is a smaller, friendly boutique hotel in Midtown Manhattan, with comfortable rooms, attentive staff, and amenities like free coffee, tea, and internet; some reviewers highlight the personalized service and the hotel's ability to create a welcoming atmosphere. The hotel's location near the Empire State Building and subway stations provides convenient access to various parts of the city.

The Hotel Deauville is known for its friendly and helpful staff, with some guests feeling as though they are in their "home away from home". It is located in the heart of NYC, with comfortable and recently refurbished rooms.

The hotel is described as cozy with a helpful 24-hour front desk staff, and offers a daily continental breakfast, a 24-hour rooftop terrace, and 24-hour use of computers. Reviewers mention a friendly and almost personal experience, with staff going the extra mile to be helpful.

Hotel Elysee is a small, European-style boutique hotel with a homey feel, offering comfortable rooms, complimentary breakfast, afternoon wine and cheese, and a library-style lounge. Many reviewers mention the friendly and helpful staff, making it a welcoming and relaxing place to stay.

The hotel aims to make every guest feel like a VIP with a warm, welcoming staff, and some guests described the hotel as making them feel at home. There are repeat customers who have stayed multiple times.

Hotel Giraffe is known for its comfortable and quiet atmosphere, with guests feeling welcomed by the accommodating staff. It also features a comfortable lobby, continental breakfast, evening wine and cheese, and amenities like newspapers and a laptop.

The Grand Union Hotel offers a comfortable and clean stay with friendly staff, making it a potential budget-friendly base for exploring NYC. Some reviewers mention the Captain's Cafe for breakfast and highlight the hotel's central location near attractions and subway lines.

The Hotel Indigo offers comfortable beds and spacious rooms for NYC, with a modern minimalist design, Aveda toiletries, and a quiet HVAC system. Some rooms have a chair and small table, and the hotel is located close to restaurants and subway lines.

Hotel Mela is a boutique hotel with friendly staff and a home-like ambiance, offering comfortable rooms with luxurious bedding. Guests appreciate the attentive service, with staff going out of their way to make their stay enjoyable.
Hotel Metro is well-located near Penn Station and Macy's, with clean rooms and a complimentary breakfast. Guests appreciate the helpful staff, 24/7 coffee, and comfortable lounge.

Hotel Newton is described as a clean and comfortable budget hotel, conveniently located near the subway and Central Park, making it a practical base for exploring the city, with friendly staff and a welcoming atmosphere. Some reviewers mention that they have stayed at Hotel Newton multiple times and would choose it again for future trips.

The Hotel on Rivington is described as having spacious rooms, comfortable beds, well-stocked minibars, cookies at turndown, friendly staff and a great location with many shops and restaurants nearby. Several reviewers mention that the hotel staff is helpful and welcoming, making for a pleasant stay.
Hotel Reserve is a small hotel that aims to provide great service, a friendly atmosphere, and a home away from home. The staff looks after their guests individually and gets to know them.

The St. James Hotel is a budget-friendly option with a great location near Times Square, offering clean but basic rooms, friendly staff, and a helpful concierge, with amenities like free Wi-Fi. Many guests recommend the nearby Cranberry Deli for affordable meals and emphasize the hotel's convenience for exploring the city.

The Hotel Stanford is praised for its ideal location near transportation, shopping, and attractions, with some reviewers highlighting the friendly and helpful staff, clean rooms, and a basic continental breakfast. Some reviewers mention that the staff remembers them when they return, and they feel safe and comfortable in the hotel and surrounding area.

Hotel Wales is described as quaint with old-world decor, aiming for a warm, home-like atmosphere with cozy common areas and staff that try to be friendly and helpful. Some reviewers mention feeling like a neighborhood local and enjoying the hotel as a home away from home.

The rooms are small and the halls are dark and often described as feeling like a "coffin," a "prison," or a "jail cell," but the staff is friendly and some reviewers describe it as a home away from home. The hotel is close to the subway and Central Park.

The Ink48 Kimpton hotel is known for its friendly and helpful staff who go out of their way to be accommodating. The hotel offers amenities such as a complimentary breakfast, evening wine reception, and newspapers.

The Inn New York City is a small, apartment-style inn that feels like a private home, with uniquely decorated suites, full kitchens stocked with complimentary food and drinks, and personalized service. Guests appreciate the quiet, residential location near Central Park and the subway, as well as the privacy and comfort of the accommodations.

Many reviewers mention the Intercontinental Barclay's comfortable beds and convenient location, as well as its professional and helpful staff. Some guests note the hotel's old-world charm, describing it as a quality hotel that makes them feel at home.

The Essex House is in a fantastic location across from Central Park with spacious rooms and comfortable beds. Reviewers found the staff to be nice and helpful and noted that the hotel is a building of historical interest.

The Kitano is known for being a quiet, clean, and comfortable hotel with a professional staff, with some repeat visitors noting that the staff recognizes them. The hotel provides amenities like robes, slippers, and umbrellas, with some reviewers describing the atmosphere as tranquil and a welcome retreat.

The La Quinta Inn Manhattan is praised for being immaculate, comfortable, and a great value, with some guests noting they have stayed there multiple times. The hotel offers amenities such as free internet, breakfast, and newspapers.

Lafayette House is a boutique hotel in a townhouse with individually furnished rooms featuring sitting areas with fireplaces, and some rooms have kitchenettes and access to a courtyard garden; guests have described it as feeling like arriving at their own brownstone home. The hotel is located in the East Village, close to various restaurants, and offers a more private, local NYC experience.

Le Parker Meridien is well-located and known for having a helpful staff, and many reviewers mention SPG upgrades and a comfortable king-sized bed. Some found the rooms to be spacious, while others noted the junior suites include a separate living room, and that the rooms were great for families.

The Library Hotel offers a welcoming, homey atmosphere due to its friendly staff, 24/7 access to coffee and snacks in the reading room, and evening wine and cheese receptions. The hotel features uniquely themed rooms with books, aiming to create a comfortable and calm environment for guests.

The Regency is praised for its friendly staff, comfortable rooms, and convenient location near shops and Central Park, creating a welcoming atmosphere; some reviewers mention long-time staff who remember guests. Guests also appreciate details like free coffee, lemonade, and umbrellas, as well as amenities for pets and children.

The Lowell is a small, intimate hotel on the Upper East Side that some guests describe as a home away from home. Select rooms feature kitchenettes, and the staff is known to remember guests' preferences.
Many reviewers mention that the staff is attentive, helpful, and friendly. Several guests describe the hotel as a sanctuary.

Many guests found the staff at Milford Plaza friendly and helpful, the hotel safe and secure, and the location convenient, all of which may contribute to a home-like feel. One reviewer mentioned the room had "a touch of warmness of home".

The Millenium Hilton aims to provide a safe and welcoming atmosphere with staff who are polite, discrete, and helpful. Some guests mention the hotel feels like a refuge and provides a home away from home, highlighting the friendly and attentive service.

The Millenium Broadway receives mixed reviews, but some reviewers found the staff friendly and helpful and appreciated the clean rooms and comfortable beds. Though some found the hotel impersonal and cold, others felt at ease and at home there.

The Millennium UN Plaza offers large, clean rooms with comfortable beds, panoramic city and river views, and friendly staff, making it a useful and comfortable base with a quiet atmosphere, though some find the decor outdated. It is located near Grand Central Station, has useful transport links, and offers a pool and fitness center, but lacks in-room coffee makers in some rooms.

The Moderne Hotel is described as a small, clean, and comfortable hotel with friendly and helpful staff, offering free coffee and tea in a cozy lounge area and a location close to many attractions. Some guests felt at ease and at home during their stay.

Morgans Hotel is described as feeling like a residence rather than a hotel, with staff that are helpful and make guests feel welcome. The hotel also has a "living room" on the fourth floor with complimentary tea and coffee, TVs, and magazines for guests to relax and plan their travels.

Murray Hill East Suites is described as feeling like an apartment, with large rooms, full kitchens, and a quiet, safe neighborhood. Many reviewers mention that they would stay there again, with several referring to it as a "home away from home".

Murray Hill Inn has friendly and helpful staff, with a good location near restaurants and transportation that makes it feel like home; some guests have returned multiple times and developed a rapport with the staff. Some reviewers mention the hotel provides a personal touch, friendly smiles and advice when requested.

The Marriott Downtown is a comfortable hotel with clean, spacious rooms and exceptionally comfortable beds, with staff that aims to please. Many reviewers mention that they would return, and that it is their home base when they visit NYC.

The Marriott East Side has been described as charming, homey, and quiet, with some reviewers stating they have returned to stay there multiple times, or would never stay anywhere else. Rooms are described as clean, comfortable, and well-maintained, with standard Marriott service.

Some reviewers describe the hotel as clean and comfortable, with very comfortable beds, a good level of service, and efficient staff; reward members also regularly stay at this location. It has a high level of safety, with friendly staff and large rooms, but is seen as impersonal by some.

The New York Palace is known for its comfortable beds, spacious rooms, exceptional service, and a friendly staff, making it feel welcoming. Some reviewers mention feeling like royalty, and some also noted repeat visits and a desire to return.

The Night Hotel offers a convenient location near Times Square and features a stylish, intimate atmosphere, with some reviewers noting the friendly staff and comfortable beds that make it feel like home. However, some guests found the rooms small and dark, and noted the potential for noise.
Many reviewers found the hotel to be conveniently located to attractions, with friendly staff. The rooms had a homelike feel and were clean with comfortable beds and a good size.

Off Soho Suites offers apartment-like suites with amenities like a kitchenette, fridge, and comfortable beds, creating a home-away-from-home feel, and some reviewers mention they have returned to stay again. The hotel is located within walking distance of multiple neighborhoods and subway lines, with friendly staff.

The Omni Berkshire Place is known for its wonderful staff, cleanliness, and location, making guests feel at home, and many return. Some reviewers note that they are repeat customers who feel especially welcome and valued by the staff.

On the Ave is located in a quiet Upper West Side neighborhood, near subway stations, restaurants and shops. Some reviewers mention they are repeat customers, and others liked the residential feel of the location, with staff being accommodating.

Park 79 is located in a quiet Upper West Side neighborhood close to Central Park and subway stations, and some reviewers mention the friendly and helpful staff. The hotel offers free coffee in the lobby and some returning guests appreciate the familiar atmosphere.

The Park Central Hotel has comfortable beds and is in a central location, making it easy to access various parts of the city. Some reviewers note a friendly staff and helpful service, creating a welcoming atmosphere.

The Park South Hotel is a smaller boutique hotel with a friendly staff, a great breakfast, and a nice bar/bistro atmosphere, located close to the subway. Some reviewers have stayed multiple times, citing the cleanliness, good service, and reasonable prices.

The Peninsula is described as cozy and intimate, aiming to make stays as comfortable as possible with spacious, well-decorated rooms and comfortable beds. Some guests appreciate being greeted by name and the staff's warmth, creating a welcoming and personalized experience.

The Phillips Club offers studio, one, and two-bedroom apartments with kitchens for daily, weekly, or monthly rentals, creating a home-like environment with amenities like full-sized appliances. It is conveniently located near Lincoln Center and Columbus Circle, with easy access to transportation, and features services such as maid service and a helpful staff.

The Plaza Athenee is a smaller, intimate hotel with a European, residential feel, aiming to provide a quiet and friendly atmosphere. Repeat customers feel comfortable there, with staff known for their attentiveness and commitment to making guests feel at home.

The Radisson Martinique is in a central location with friendly staff, and often has flight crews staying there; the doormen are very helpful and some guests have had sleep number beds. It is located near a subway and Penn Station.

The Ramada Eastside has friendly staff, clean rooms, comfortable beds, and offers a free breakfast, free wireless internet, and free phone calls within the US. Some reviewers mention the hotel felt home-like.

The Red Roof Inn is frequently described as a clean and comfortable hotel with a good location, convenient breakfast, and helpful staff, with many reviewers noting they would stay again. A number of reviewers mention long stays of 3+ nights, suggesting a comfortable and home-like experience.

Hotel 57 is described as a smaller, more intimate boutique hotel with well-designed, modern rooms and comfortable beds; some reviewers mentioned feeling at home and enjoying the hotel's chic, NYC feel. Select rooms feature terraces and kitchen appliances.
Many reviewers mention that the staff was friendly, helpful and courteous, and made them feel at home. Some guests have been recognized by staff and welcomed back on return visits.

The Residence Inn Times Square has spacious, clean rooms with kitchens and comfortable beds, and offers complimentary breakfast, a 3rd-floor lounge, and laundry facilities. Staff create a friendly, helpful atmosphere, and the hotel is conveniently located near Times Square and other attractions.

The Ritz-Carlton Battery Park is known for its polite and discreet staff, quality furnishings, and exceptional cleanliness, with some reviewers describing it as a home away from home. The hotel is also praised for staff who remember guests' names and cater to children, creating a welcoming and personalized experience.

The hotel offers free internet access, complimentary bottled water, and extra towels/soaps/coffee/tea available on each floor. There is also a 7th-floor deck overlooking the skating rink with a space to dine and socialize.

The Roger Smith Hotel is described as having a homely feel, comfortable rooms, and a friendly staff that provides excellent service. Many reviewers mention the hotel feels like a home away from home, with unique, spacious rooms and a welcoming atmosphere.

The Roger Williams Hotel is described as clean, comfortable, and well-located, with staff noted for being friendly, helpful and remembering guests' names, and a lounge designed to feel like a living room. Some reviewers noted that the hotel felt safe, stylish, and user-friendly.
The hotel is described as clean and pleasant with a nice welcome and helpful staff. Some reviewers said the hotel has comfortable beds, good breakfast, and DirecTV.

The Royalton is centrally located in midtown Manhattan and aims to provide a personal, human-scale experience with staff interested in the guests. Many reviewers mention the friendly and helpful service, with some noting that the staff went out of their way to provide assistance and a personal touch.

The Salisbury Hotel has spacious rooms with amenities like kitchenettes, walk-in closets, and separate living areas, offering a comfortable and home-like atmosphere. It's located in a central area, close to attractions like Central Park and Times Square.

The San Carlos is a smaller boutique hotel with spacious rooms, a friendly staff, and a quiet atmosphere that makes guests feel at home. Many reviewers mention the hotel's cleanliness, comfortable beds, and convenient amenities such as a microwave, refrigerator, and coffee maker, as well as a business center with free internet access.

The Seafarers International House is described as basic, clean, and comfortable, with a location right beside Union Square. Some reviewers mention that the rooms remind them of staying at their grandparents' house, giving it a home-like feel.

Many guests noted that staff, especially Jorge Guerrero, went out of their way to provide excellent, personalized service and to ensure guests had a pleasant stay. Guests also highlight the comfortable beds, convenient location, and exercise facilities.

The Skyline Hotel offers spacious suites with comfortable beds and amenities like a fridge and safe. Some reviewers mention it feeling like a home away from home, and it's located within walking distance of many attractions.

The Smyth Tribeca is known for its extremely friendly and attentive staff, modern minimalist design, and clean, spacious rooms, creating a comfortable and welcoming atmosphere. The hotel is conveniently located near subway lines and offers amenities like comfortable beds and Kiehl's bath products, contributing to a pleasant and convenient stay.

The Sofitel New York is praised for its comfortable beds and service, making guests feel at home, and the staff is welcoming and sincere. The hotel's rooms are quiet and immaculate, with turn-down service and classical music playing upon return.

Many guests have enjoyed repeat stays due to the friendly staff, the option for pet-friendly accommodations, and the comfortable rooms, which include amenities such as a CD player and a well-stocked mini-bar. The hotel also offers a Grand Guest program with perks like complimentary breakfast and a welcome amenity.

Soho House is described as cosy and intimate with soundproof doors, creating a calm atmosphere and a feeling of being in a home away from home. Some reviewers mentioned that the staff was helpful, professional, and not pushy, contributing to a comfortable and welcoming environment.

The Stay Hotel has a modern lobby and helpful staff, with guests specifically mentioning Walter the concierge for his knowledge. Rooms have comfortable beds and nice linens, but are small and may be noisy due to a downstairs bar.

The Alex Hotel offers apartment-like suites with full kitchens, comfortable beds, and amenities like twice-daily cleaning, creating a home-away-from-home atmosphere, especially for longer stays. Guests appreciate the friendly and efficient staff, convenient East Side location, and the presence of local shops and restaurants frequented by residents rather than tourists.

The Belvedere Hotel is centrally located and offers a friendly atmosphere, making it a comfortable and convenient base. Rooms are equipped with a kitchenette including a fridge, microwave, and coffee maker.

The Benjamin is known for its friendly and helpful staff who greet guests by name, aiming to provide a warm and welcoming atmosphere. Some rooms have a mini-kitchen, pillow concierges, and music playing when guests arrive to give it a "home away from home" feel.

The Blakely is described as a cozy, small, and intimate boutique hotel with spacious rooms, comfortable beds, and a warm decor, making it feel like coming home. Guests appreciate the well-appointed rooms, helpful staff, and convenient amenities like kitchenettes, creating a welcoming and personal atmosphere.
The Bowery Hotel is described as having a comfortable atmosphere with a friendly staff. Some reviewers mention it having a home-like feel, with cozy and warm decor.

The Bryant Park Hotel is frequently described as providing excellent service from a friendly and accommodating staff, making it feel like a home away from home, especially for repeat customers, with modern, clean, and comfortable rooms. Some guests mention specific staff members by name and praise the team for building regular communication with guests.

The Carlton on Madison is a clean and comfortable hotel with friendly staff, comfortable beds, a convenient location near subway lines, and quiet rooms; some reviewers mentioned the staff made them feel welcome, and some described it as a home away from home. The maids and porters were the friendliest staff and the corridors are quiet at night, but other staff have been described as distant and unhelpful.

The Carlyle has a residential feel, with spacious suites and personalized, caring service from long-term staff who get to know returning guests. Some reviewers mention that it feels like staying at a wealthy aunt's apartment.

The Franklin Hotel is described as a charming, quaint, and clean boutique hotel with a European feel, offering a complimentary continental breakfast, 24/7 coffee, and evening wine and cheese, with friendly and helpful staff that create a home-like atmosphere. It has an intimate feeling, and is located on the upper east side near the subway, Central Park, and museums.

The French Quarters Guest Apartments is a small, warm, and welcoming hotel with a New Orleans flavor, offering well-appointed and cozy rooms, some with kitchenettes. The staff is friendly and remembers guests by name, creating a personal touch.
The Gem Hotel Chelsea has a friendly staff, a modern design, and comfortable beds. Some reviewers mentioned that the hotel felt like a home away from home, and the hotel incorporates local art.
The hotel is described as feeling more like an exclusive apartment than a hotel, with small but adequate flats. Some reviewers noted the friendly staff and clean environment.

The Gem Soho is located in the Lower East Side, near multiple subway lines and various downtown neighborhoods. Some reviewers mention a home-away-from-home feel, friendly staff, and helpful recommendations.

Some reviewers mention that the staff are friendly and helpful, and some rooms have been recently renovated with modern furnishings. The hotel is located in a safe neighborhood on the Upper West Side, close to grocery stores, restaurants, and the subway.

The Hampton Inn Times Square North is known for its friendly, helpful staff and clean, spacious rooms, creating a welcoming atmosphere; the lobby offers complimentary hot beverages and there is a luggage room available. Many guests highlight the attentive service and comfortable accommodations, making it a popular choice for repeat visits and longer stays.
The hotel features spacious rooms, some with kitchenettes and sitting areas, and offers junior suites. It also has permanent residents, and some rooms have balconies overlooking Central Park.

The Helmsley Park Lane has a great location across from Central Park and near subway stations and is a manageable size, with personable service and a guest-centric staff that greets guests by name, some guests have been returning for many years. It can also cater to special requests.

Herald Square Hotel is known for its friendly staff, cleanliness, convenient location near transportation and attractions, and comfortable beds, with some reviewers noting a cozy atmosphere and a sense of community. Some reviewers mention returning multiple times, and the availability of amenities like free coffee, laundry, and helpful staff.

Hotel 91 is a clean and comfortable hotel with friendly staff who are happy to help, making it feel like a home away from home; it offers a lounge with free tea and coffee 24/7. It is located in Chinatown, close to the subway and within walking distance of many attractions.

The Hotel at Times Square has friendly staff, a business center, a fitness room, and offers free continental breakfast, creating a comfortable and convenient atmosphere. Some reviewers mention they have stayed at this hotel multiple times over the years.

The Inn at Irving Place is located in a quiet area of Manhattan and is furnished with antiques, aiming to create a cozy atmosphere. Some found it to feel more like being at home than in a faceless hotel, while others mentioned the building has wood floors, open stairs, and thin windows that let in noise.

The Iroquois is described as a charming, cozy, and intimate boutique hotel with a friendly and helpful staff, aiming to provide a "home away from home" experience. Reviews mention personal touches like staff remembering guest names, comfortable rooms, and a welcoming atmosphere.

The Jane Hotel has permanent residents, creating a rooming house atmosphere, and the staff is very friendly, making guests feel at home. Some rooms have river and skyline views, and the hotel has a vintage lobby.

The Kimberly Hotel offers spacious suites with kitchens, separate living areas, and amenities like comfortable beds, terry robes, and a printer/fax machine, providing a "home away from home" experience. It is located close to major attractions and public transportation, with a friendly and attentive staff enhancing the welcoming atmosphere.

The Lombardy is a boutique hotel with spacious studio or one-bedroom apartments, each individually owned and decorated, creating a unique and quiet residential feel. Many reviewers mention the rooms having kitchenettes, which gives it an apartment-like feel.

The London NYC's rooms feel like private apartments, with spacious, immaculately clean suites that are quiet and soundproof; some reviewers mention they keep coming back to this hotel and consider it their home away from home in NYC. Several reviewers also highlight the warm, helpful, and attentive staff.

The Lucerne is described as clean, comfortable, and homey, with a courteous staff and a traditionally decorated hotel with attention to detail. Some guests appreciated the newspapers, coffee machine, and home-like atmosphere, as well as the quiet rooms and convenient Upper West Side location.

The Manhattan Club offers spacious suites with amenities like a mini-kitchen, and free coffee/tea in the owner's lounge, providing a comfortable and convenient stay. Timeshare owners express feeling at home and enjoying the central location for easy access to city attractions.

The Mansfield is a small, older boutique hotel with a marble entrance hall, library/lounge with free coffee, and a bar area, with friendly staff. It has a convenient Midtown location near shops, restaurants, and subway access, and offers comfortable rooms, though some are very small and may have old, noisy AC units.

The Marcel at Gramercy is known for its friendly and helpful staff, who go out of their way to assist guests, and a rooftop lounge that provides free coffee and internet, with some reviewers noting a welcoming atmosphere that made them feel at home. Some reviewers appreciated the neighborhood feel of the hotel.

The Maritime Hotel has a nautical theme with small, well-designed rooms, comfortable beds, and amenities such as free Wi-Fi, a DVD player, and a well-stocked minibar. Some reviewers mention a friendly and helpful staff that provides excellent service.

The Mark is located on the Upper East Side near museums, art galleries, Central Park, and upscale shopping, with roomy and comfortably appointed rooms; some reviewers mention receiving excellent customer service, including on-call doctor service and staff going out of their way to assist guests. Some rooms include kitchenettes, and complimentary snacks, soda, and water.

The Marmara Manhattan offers spacious apartment-style rooms with full kitchens, providing a comfortable extended stay experience. Guests appreciate the friendly staff, convenient location on the Upper East Side near grocery stores and restaurants, and amenities like free Wi-Fi.

The Mave has a friendly and helpful staff that provides excellent customer service and makes guests feel at home, with clean rooms and comfortable beds. Some guests mentioned that the hotel felt like a trendy New York apartment building, and the staff was very warm, professional, and kind.

The Mercer is known for its friendly and helpful staff, a welcoming atmosphere, and a comfortable lobby that feels like a living room, where only hotel residents can eat or drink. Guests appreciate the attention to detail, such as personalized notes and fresh flowers, creating a tranquil and relaxing environment.

The Michelangelo is known for its spacious rooms, quiet atmosphere, and attentive staff, which contribute to a calming and relaxing environment. It is centrally located, providing easy access to many NYC attractions.

The Milburn Hotel is frequently described as a home away from home due to its apartment-like rooms with kitchenettes, comfortable beds, and a location in a safe, residential neighborhood, allowing guests to feel like locals. The hotel's welcoming staff, 24-hour room service, and proximity to grocery stores further contribute to a comfortable and convenient stay.

The Muse Hotel is a smaller, boutique-style hotel with creative decor that aims to feel comfy and cozy, with some offering perks such as a wineglass invitation every afternoon. Some found the rooms charming, comfy, and creative, while others reported issues with the standard of housekeeping and noise.

The New York Helmsley has friendly and helpful staff, and some reviewers felt very comfortable and well cared for. There are reports of helpful front desk personnel and concierge service, along with other conveniences.

The New Yorker Hotel offers a central location near Penn Station and various attractions, with clean, though small, rooms, and amenities like free Wi-Fi and a diner. The hotel has friendly staff, comfortable beds, and security measures.

The Pierre is located across from Central Park and offers a personalized experience, with staff remembering guests by name and providing a welcoming atmosphere. Some reviewers mention it feels like a private residence, with a traditional style, elevator operators, and Rolls Royce service.

Some guests found the staff warm, friendly and focused on responsive customer service, and some guests appreciated being addressed by their last name and asked if they wanted more of anything. Some guests also mentioned the butlers being readily available and attentive.

The Pod Hotel is described as a clean, comfortable, and safe place that travelers on a budget can use as a base for exploring the city. The small but well-designed rooms and welcoming atmosphere lead some guests to describe it as feeling like a "home" away from home.

The Premier is described as a quiet and peaceful haven with modern, clean, and comfortable rooms that are well-isolated from outside noise, offering amenities such as complimentary breakfast, evening drinks, and personable staff. Some guests mention feeling welcomed and at home, and some enjoyed the hotel's common parts.

The Ritz-Carlton Central Park is known for outstanding service and staff that remember guests' names, with doormen offering water and fruit for morning walks. Some reviewers felt at home, citing the hotel's care, attention to detail, and service, with one reviewer noting a complimentary usage of facilities to freshen up.
Many reviewers praise the Roosevelt's convenient location, comfortable beds, and kind staff. Some reviewers mention feeling safe and at home at the hotel.

The Sherry-Netherland is described as a small, intimate hotel that feels like a luxury apartment, with individually owned and decorated rooms. Regular guests are greeted by name, creating a familiar and welcoming atmosphere.

The Shoreham is a smaller property hotel in a great midtown location with a minimal and soft white color design, and rooms have a calm and serene feeling. Guests mention comfortable beds, helpful front desk staff, and efficient housekeepers.

The St. Regis is known for its outstanding service, friendly staff, butler service, and luxurious rooms, making guests feel comfortable and well-cared for. Many reviewers mention feeling at home and experiencing a relaxing atmosphere, with some noting that the staff's friendliness made the hotel feel like a home away from home.
The hotel has attentive staff and smaller, but well-designed rooms to maximize space. Some reviewers stated that the hotel felt like a home away from home.
The Surrey is described as feeling like a home away from home, with welcoming staff and a humble atmosphere. It offers spacious suites with kitchenettes, providing a comfortable and convenient stay.

The Sylvan Guest House is described as a warm, safe, and comfortable environment that feels like home, with clean apartments that match the online photos. Guests have noted the friendly hosts, the ability to host family, and the welcoming atmosphere.

The Time Hotel offers comfortable beds, a trendy bar, and a location right off Times Square; some reviewers mention friendly and helpful staff. Some reviewers mentioned small rooms and limited storage space.

The Waldorf Astoria is described as an old, grand hotel that is beautiful and a classic piece of New York history, with comfortable, clean, and spacious rooms, thick walls, heavy wood doors, thick gold drapes, and heavy handles. The staff is friendly and helpful, the lobby is warm and pleasant, and some reviewers mention that it feels like a home away from home.

The Westin New York at Times Square is praised for its friendly and helpful staff, clean rooms, and excellent service, with some reviewers noting they felt welcome and at home during their stay. The hotel has comfortable beds, and quiet rooms despite its central location, with some guests appreciating the personal touches and recognition from the staff.

Some reviewers describe Hotel Thirty Thirty as a "home away from home" due to the helpful management, comfortable beds, and the presence of amenities like safes. A few reviews mention long-term residents, giving the hotel a more residential feel.

Some guests found the staff friendly, welcoming, and helpful, with doormen offering assistance and the hotel providing complimentary newspapers and evening treats. A few reviewers mentioned feeling comfortable during their stay, and one appreciated the cleanliness and design of the rooms.

The Travel Inn is a clean and comfortable hotel with ample-sized rooms, a pool, a deli, and free parking, where staff are friendly and helpful. Some reviewers mentioned they have stayed at the hotel multiple times and would return.

The Tribeca Grand is praised for its exceptional and friendly staff who remember guests and record their preferences. It offers a comfortable atmosphere with amenities like in-room coffee machines, goldfish, and CD players.

The Trump International Hotel features spacious rooms, full kitchens, and are described as having a residential feel. Guests receive personalized service and can expect luxurious amenities like chocolates at turndown, complimentary drinks, and a well-equipped gym.
The Tudor Hotel is described as having small but cozy rooms with comfortable beds, and a quiet atmosphere. It is located a few blocks from Grand Central Station, in a quiet part of town.

The Avalon is a centrally located hotel with large, clean rooms, free internet, and many repeat customers who appreciate the friendly, helpful staff and a strong European character. Breakfast is included, though it may be inconsistent, and some found the rooms to be quiet and comfortable, with comfortable beds and a good night's sleep.

The W New York - The Court is known for its friendly and helpful staff, with some reviewers mentioning personalized service and feeling like valued guests. Suites are available and considered spacious for New York, with comfortable beds and some offering city views.

The W Tuscany aims to create a comfy atmosphere with its "living room" lobby, crisp apples, and fruit-filled water at the front desk. The staff is attentive and aims to provide personalized service, with some reviewers feeling welcomed and remembered.

Some reviewers mention that the staff is attentive and helpful and try to make the hotel a little more like home, extra amenities are available to make the trip even more special, and a friendly staff. Many reviewers note it is a monthly business stay.

The W Union Square is frequently praised for its excellent service, with staff often going the extra mile and creating a welcoming atmosphere. Some reviewers note the hotel's comfortable beds and convenient location, making it a pleasant and accessible home base for exploring the city.

The Waldorf Towers is described as having a private feeling, with some reviewers mentioning the staff, especially bellmen, by name and feeling like they are visiting family. There is a lounge on the 26th floor, with food and drinks, and the location is described as central to many attractions.

The Wall Street Inn is described as a small, quiet, and clean hotel with a friendly staff, making it a comfortable and welcoming place to stay, especially on weekends. Some reviewers who stayed for over a week felt at home.
The Warwick is a historic, centrally located hotel known for its helpful staff, repeat guests, and some quiet rooms. Some reviewers describe a cozy, home-like feel and a neighborhood that feels safe.

The hotel is praised for its friendly and helpful staff, with some reviewers specifically mentioning the bellboy London, and reception staff being welcoming and polite. Some guests felt safe and comfortable, with some recommending it for solo female travelers.

The Washington Square Hotel has a charming atmosphere, friendly staff, and is located in a safe neighborhood; continental breakfast is included. The hotel is family run, and has clean, comfortable rooms with art deco touches.

The Wellington is known for its excellent location near major attractions like Central Park and Times Square and its friendly, helpful staff who go out of their way to assist guests. The hotel aims to provide a comfortable stay, creating a welcoming atmosphere reminiscent of staying at a family home.

The hotel has a studio apartment feel with modern decor, comfortable beds, a desk area, and a variety of TV channels. Some reviewers mentioned that the staff learned their names and went out of their way to be welcoming, offering assistance with tasks such as hailing a taxi and making reservations.

The Wingate is praised for its friendly and helpful staff, clean and comfortable rooms, and convenient location, with some reviewers considering it their new home in NYC. The hotel provides amenities such as complimentary breakfast, free internet, and a gym, contributing to a comfortable and welcoming experience.

The Wolcott Hotel, built in 1904, is centrally located near the Empire State Building and offers amenities such as complimentary coffee and muffins in the lobby and rooms with a safe. Reviews mention the friendly staff, clean rooms, and a grand lobby, creating a pleasant and convenient base for exploring the city.

Woogo Central Park provides apartment-style accommodations with kitchenettes, making it convenient for longer stays and those who prefer to prepare their own meals; some reviewers felt like a resident of NYC, while others noted the experience is a no-frills one. Note that cleaning services are not always automatic and may require a request in advance.

The Wyndham Garden Hotel has a helpful and pleasant staff and is well-equipped, with amenities like umbrellas, free internet use, and newspaper delivery. A guest mentioned the staff provided a level of professionalism, service, and genuine caring that made them feel like family.
